text: I go there to see the kids and the

the moment just you know maybe inspire
them they would have no clue maybe Who I
am
I don't not one person really said like
oh you're the tennis player nobody did
that and that was so wonderful
that's exactly how I wanted to be that's
really one of the reasons I do it
because I think giving money is a
wonderful thing but seeing it in person
is an entirely different animal this is
another visit in Africa for you with
your foundation why is this continent so
important to you well it's very close to
my heart
it all starts that I was here very often
was younger with my mom being South
African and just being here on vacation
time and time again visiting family and
so when I became a bit of a tennis
player I always thought you know this is
a place where I want to give back to and
I'm happy I did because I really love
coming back here by 2018 your foundation
aims to touch the lives of more than a
million children here in Africa do you
think that's feasible so I mean I think
it's very feasible to reach the goal of
touching the lives of 1 million kids in
you know in the southern in southern
Africa we support 7 countries through
many different projects and partners
it's been wonderful to have the right
partners and of course we need the
communities the parents the teachers all
the people involved you know because me
by myself there's no way I can do it you
know so I think we're having a really
good team and just got to keep you know
raising more money talking about it a
bit more even though I keep it on a very
low level because I feel like the work
is what matters not what people think of
what you're doing a lot of people have
described you as a very warm
kind-hearted and gracious person is that
what you also try to teach the children
that you you you can you work with in
Malawi I probably do you know I
yeah I'm very honest and relaxed and
open and war
I yes I enjoy interacting with people
any any person really who I meet I love
meeting new people being a role model I
know for not for every athlete is really
that important but for me it always has
ever since I've reached a stage
maybe world number one or winning
Wimbledon that I realized people are
looking up to me I took that role
important to me it's important I'm happy
when parents come up to me and says I'm
so happy that you are how you are how
you play how you handle yourself
because my kid loves you adores you and

the end of day probably what it's all
